title: Riot, Please fix your launcher!
body:
I recently built a new PC (Windows 10) and after installing League of Legends I am unable to launch the game. After pressing the 'Launch' button, it appears grey, where I am unable to do anything. I am not sure if there is a fix to this solution but I am not keen on reinstalling due to my Internet speed. Also, this has happened to several of my friends who have Windows 10.

I have tried:

Disabling my firewall, antivirus, etc.
Running League of Legends as Administrator.
Using the horribly broken 'Repair Tool'. (If you can call it that)

Thanks.

replies.body:
I also have windows 10 with the same issue. I contacted support and got linked fixes that don't work. I have reinstalled twice and it works only the first time I run the game. On the second launch it greys out and becomes unusable until I reinstall it. I have tried reinstalling without antivirus and firewall off also, along with the administrator option. The repair tool does absolutely **NOTHING**. 

~~Please~~_** FIX THIS RIOT.**_

If you are considering a reinstall, another option is to force a repatch of your client instead (which is often better than a repair but not a whole reinstall);

> ##HOW TO FORCE A REPATCH:

* Go to your Riot Games folder (Default path: C:/Riot Games/League of Legends)
* Open the following directory:
 * C:\Riot Games\League of Legends\RADS\projects\lol_air_client\releases\{highest version number}
* Delete the following files:
 - releasemanifest 
 - S_OK
* Open the Deploy folder
* Delete the following folders/files:
 - lib (folder) 
 - META-INF (folder) 
 - mod (folder) 
 - lolclient.exe (file) 
 - lolclient.swf (file) 
 - locale.properties (file)
* Restart League of Legends

> ##IF THAT DID NOT WORK, PLEASE TRY THE FOLLOWING:

* Delete the following folder:
 * <C:\Riot Games\League of Legends\RADS\projects\lol_launcher
* Restart League of Legends

Attempted both of these:
- The first repatched, but the issue of having a greyed out launch button after pressing the orange launch button remained.
- The second fix didn't seem to change anything somehow

Could you try running it in compatibility mode? Right click the shortcut, go to properties, Compatibility tab, and check the box and select an older OS. If it's already in compatibility mode, turn it off.

i playted LOL a week ago fine after fixing the damn PVP.net keral crash problem. now its happening again.

i have no idea what i can do to fix the damn problem. i wish riot would fix the problem with a new launcher and or a fix for windows 10
